intro: Hebenstretia discoidea, commonly known as the Cape snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a small, deciduous shrub that produces fluffy, white spherical flower heads, which resemble snowballs, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, also known as the daisy or sunflower family. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
